rules.title: Character Background and Progression
rules.description: Always have a backstory for your character and ensure its progression aligns with this narrative.

rules.title: Respect for Roleplay
rules.description: Avoid disrespecting or interacting with unconscious or deceased characters. Acts like using the piss emote or verbal abuse are immature and toxic. Prioritize mature roleplay.

rules.title: AFK at Your Own Risk
rules.description: If you go AFK, you can't expect others to pause their scenarios.

rules.title: Character Interaction Separation
rules.description: Your characters should not interact, transfer money, or share memories between them. Using a middleman for such interactions is also forbidden.

rules.title: Voice Confirmation in Scenarios
rules.description: Characters shouldn’t be identified by their player's voice.

rules.title: Fail RP Guidelines
rules.description: Failing to roleplay realistically or not adhering to server rules during an RP scenario is considered Fail RP and is punishable.

rules.title: Law Enforcement Interaction
description: Lawful Entry to the City: Upon entry, build your character's story rather than jumping into crime.
Police Procedures: Police will only search you or your vehicle if you ignore their orders or engage in a chase.
Interference in Police Scenarios: Civilians shouldn't interfere in ongoing police scenarios or kidnap officers/doctors in police presence.
Avoid Policing the Police: Don’t critique officers based on the server's police rules.
Police Warrants: Warrants are valid for three days.
Mask/Helmet Investigation: Police can investigate those wearing masks or helmets for identity concealment.

rules.title: Driving and Vehicle Use
description: Stunt Regulations: Committing stunts, like excessive horn use or bike wheelies in front of the police, can result in a license revocation.
No Escape Through Water: Don’t end chases by diving into water. If fallen accidentally, exit ASAP.
Vehicle Change During Pursuit: Don't switch to a stored vehicle during a chase. Only switch to vehicles already outside.

rules.title: Combat and Confrontations
description: Gun Misfire Accountability: Gun misfires are in-character (IC) and can’t be excused as out-of-character (OOC) mistakes.
RP First, Shooting Last: Prioritize roleplay over violence. Shooting should be a last resort.
Armed Running and Police Warning: Police may shoot if you run with a weapon, after a warning shot.
Shootout Location Planning: Shooting locations can be pre-planned, but they should be a secondary option to escaping.
No Shootouts Near Teleportation Blips: Avoid combat near teleportation locations.

rules.title: Heists, Robberies, and Kidnappings
description: Realistic Heist Scenarios: Don’t use vehicles as barriers inside heist locations.
Cooperating with Kidnappers: If kidnapped, cooperate fully. Pretend you don’t recognize the kidnappers, even if you know them OOC.
Proper Negotiation in Robbery: Negotiate as if surrounded by police, even if only one officer responds.
Hostage Priority: Value hostages’ lives. Don't base actions on OOC knowledge of police numbers.
Robbery Aims: Focus on escaping with loot and teammates rather than fighting the police.
Cool Down Robberies: In case of robbery bugs, it's the robber's duty to escape before the police arrive. Don't mention OOC bugs during gameplay.
Gang-Related Activities: Don't involve regular chases in gang territories or call gang members for backup unless it's a gang event.
Forced ATM Withdrawals: Players can't be forced to withdraw money or sell assets.
Roleplay Reason for Hostage Attacks: Always have a roleplay reason to harm a hostage.
No Kidnapping on Bikes or Cycles: Use cars for kidnappings, not bikes or bicycles.
